scenario: You're standing at the top of a gentle green run for the first time today. How do you feel?

options.text: Nervous - I need someone to guide me down
A bit cautious, but I know I can wedge down safely
Comfortable - greens are warm-up terrain for me
Looking for something more challenging already

scenario: A friend invites you to ski a blue run. What's your honest reaction?

options.text: No way - that's beyond my ability right now
Maybe, but only if it's a very easy blue
Sure, blues are where I spend most of my time
Of course - I prefer blues and blacks anyway

scenario: You're picking up speed faster than expected. What do you do?

options.text: I might panic or fall trying to stop
Make my wedge bigger until I slow down
Do a hockey stop or controlled parallel turns
Shape my turns to manage speed instinctively

scenario: You need to make a left turn. How do your skis move?

options.text: I'm not sure - I just try to point left somehow
I push out my right ski to make a wedge turn
Both skis stay parallel as I shift my weight
I tip onto my right edges and carve through the turn

scenario: The run suddenly gets steeper. What happens next?

options.text: I would probably need to sit down or sidestep
Make very wide, slow turns across the entire slope
Shorten my turns and stay more in the fall line
Commit forward and use quick edge transitions

scenario: You're skiing and someone suddenly stops in front of you. How do you react?

options.text: I might crash - I can't stop quickly yet
Do a big wedge to slow down and turn around them
Hockey stop or sharp parallel turn to avoid them
Quick carved turn with instant stop if needed

scenario: You encounter a small patch of ice mid-run. What happens?

options.text: I'd probably lose control or fall
Slow way down and carefully edge around it
Stay balanced and ski through maintaining edge grip
Adjust pressure and edge angle without thinking

scenario: It snowed 6 inches last night. You're at the top of an ungroomed run. What do you do?

options.text: Find a groomed run instead - powder is too hard
Give it a try but expect to struggle and fall
Adjust my technique - more two-footed, keep speed up
Perfect! Use my powder technique and float through

scenario: You're loading the chairlift. How comfortable are you?

options.text: Still learning - I need help or slow the lift down

No problem - loading is automatic for me now
Totally routine - I can chat while getting on

scenario: You're skiing with poles. How do you use them?

Mostly for pushing myself on flat sections
I plant them to time the start of each turn
Rhythmic pole plants are essential to my skiing flow

scenario: You see a mogul field (bumps) ahead. What's your plan?

options.text: I'd go around - moguls are way beyond my level
Maybe try it slowly, but I'd struggle a lot
Pick a line and make controlled short turns through
Absorb and extend - moguls are fun terrain for me

scenario: End of a long ski day. How do you feel about your last run?

options.text: Exhausted - staying in control takes all my focus

Good - I skied varied terrain and improved today
One more run! I could ski challenging terrain all day
